title: Johnson’s Brexit plan has a hole so big you can swim through it
text:
A screenshot of the photo of British PM Boris Johnson pointing to the rock in Biarritz Johnson’s Brexit plan has a hole so big you can swim through it The UK PM swam out to a rock off the French coast. So did our man in Biarritz.

BIARRITZ, France — If Boris Johnson can swim out to sea and then spin a Brexit yarn out of it, then "you can too."

Those were the not necessarily wise words of a lifeguard on the beach in Biarritz when I asked him if I could swim out to a large rock that the British prime minister had brought to international attention during the G7.

Johnson took a swim in the Atlantic on Sunday, and claimed he had found a hidden hole in the rock. "Let me give you a metaphor. I swam round that rock this morning,” he told reporters. “From here you cannot tell there is a gigantic hole in that rock. There is a way through.”

“My point to the EU is that there is a way through, but you can't find the way through if you just sit on the beach,” he said.

The problem with that story is that you can see the hole in the rock — called the Roche Ronde — quite clearly from the beach. You can even see it in Johnson's own press photo.

So was Johnson telling porkies again? Or is there really something else on that rock?

As soon as the Biarritz beach was open to the public again after the summit, I decided to find out.

Red flags and warning signs at the beach told me not to go in the water, and locals said it is dangerous to swim to the rock because of underwater currents. But to my great surprise, a lifeguard was open to the idea. After briefly chatting with him about Johnson and Brexit, he said I could enter the water, saying: "If he can do it, you can too."

After a few minutes I reached the rock. It's very steep at the front but accessible from the back. And yes, there's a big hole right in the middle that you can swim through.

I swam into the hole and searched for a clue to Johnson having been there. Initials carved in the rock, a message in a bottle? Sadly, nothing.

But just as I was about to give up, I spotted a warning sign — written red on white — on the front side of the rock, warning swimmers not to climb on the rock and jump into the water.

Maybe that's the lesson Johnson learned from his swimming adventure: Don't jump from the cliff edge.
description: The UK PM swam out to a rock off the French coast. So did our man in Biarritz.
